Module com.example.miniproject2
Package com.example.miniproject2.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproject2.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
IFields, ITimer
public class GameController extends Object implements ITimer, IFields
Controller class for managing the game logic and UI interactions. Implements ITimer and IFields interfaces to handle timer functionality and field-related operations respectively.

      public void insertNumberIntoActiveTextField(int number)
      Inserts a number into the currently active TextField and validates the input.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • validateAndColorFields

      public void validateAndColorFields(javafx.scene.control.TextField txt, int row, int col, int number, boolean isClue)
      Validates the input in the specified TextField and updates its appearance based on correctness.
      Specified by:
      validateAndColorFields in interface IFields
      Parameters:
      txt - the TextField to validate
      row - the row index of the TextField in the grid
      col - the column index of the TextField in the grid
      number - the number entered into the TextField
      isClue - indicates if the number is a clue (true) or a player input (false)

    • handleHelp

      public void handleHelp(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the help button action, providing a hint if available.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the help button

    • handleExit

      public void handleExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the exit action, closing the game stage.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the exit button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during exit

    • handleRestart

      public void handleRestart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the restart action, resetting the game state and UI.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the restart button

    • handleBackToMenu

      public void handleBackToMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action of returning to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent triggered by the back to menu button
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the transition

    • handleWinEvent

      public void handleWinEvent()
      Handles the win event in the game. This method displays a victory message, disables all input fields, stops the timer, and updates the UI to indicate the win status.

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String type)
      Displays a message to the user based on the provided message type. The message will be randomly selected from predefined sets based on the type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of message to display. It can be one of the following: - "correct": Message indicating a correct action. - "incorrect": Message indicating an incorrect action. - "help": Message indicating a help action. - "noHelpsLeft": Message indicating no help is available. - "win": Message indicating a win event.
